ratings.comment: Prof. Johnson is really knowledgeable about the material and wants everyone to be successful. Lecture isn't the most riveting, but still not bad. Readings are helpful if you want to actually learn the material, but aren't necessary for an A. Main grades (outside of attendance) are 3 papers/projects w/ super flexible criteria & due dates.
A very nice professor. He is helping you to get 'A' !!!

He is an amazing guy. If you have him for a class, then don't worry it will be easy. He just is definitely more geared toward graduate students/teaching. His lectures are dry and boring for undergrads. He tried to make it more collaborative and engaging but we were limited due to COVID complications.
He is a knowledgable professor however lecture is dreadful, so boring. He does absolutely nothing to engage the class, I wouldn't take again but I thought he was nice.

He is really knowledgable, but to a fault he seems more like a grad prof than an undergrad one. He is not good at engaging the class and his lectures are nearly impossible to follow. The projects are really flexible, allowing you to explore ideas you are interested and they are graded easily. Nice guy but wouldn't take again!

He is a very monotone professor, class is extremely boring. He is a very nice person and will help you succeed if you are struggling. He doesn't do a good job at interacting with the class. He just talks the entire lecture... but there's room for creative projects.

Professor Johnson seems like a really cool guy - I would definitely love to get to know him. However, the lectures are so boring. Genuinely I never knew what was going on even when I tried to pay attention. There is no real direction. His grading expectations also aren't super clear. I would try to find a different professor honestly.

Professor Johnson clearly knows what he is talking about, but he does not do a good job of engaging the class, so his lectures can get quite boring.  I did enjoy the class though, and he was very helpful and lenient with papers, so it was overall an easy class.

It was a good class, the lectures were quite boring though.  The readings were pretty dry as well.  Grading was pretty lenient and based just on 3 essays and a small group project.  He did a great job of communicating with the class so we knew what to expect each week.

Class is easy, just four short essays and attendance, but lectures are incredibly boring -- he just repeats whatever was in the readings -- but attendance is required. Prof. Johnson is a great guy and knows his stuff, but he's not good at engaging the class or adding depth to the material.
